sections.title: Introduction — local vs cloud unit test implementation
sections.summary: Presenter contrasts implementing a unit test locally (fast) with delegating missing unit tests to an agent operating isolated in the cloud.
key_actions: Describe problem: missing unit tests for AI search
Propose using an agent in the cloud to implement missing tests

sections.title: Check repository issues and enable GitHub tooling
sections.summary: Demonstrates enabling GitHub tooling and searching repository issues to see if there's an existing issue for missing unit tests. The speaker runs a search and finds an open issue (#18).
key_actions: Enable GitHub tools / allow tool execution
Search repository issues for missing unit tests
Identify open issue #18: 'add missing unit tests for products, store and domain entity'

sections.title: Inspect issue details and decide how to assign work
sections.summary: Opens the sample repository and inspects issue #18 (scope, acceptance criteria, tasks, labels). Discusses two options to have Copilot handle it: via the GitHub UI (preferred) or directly from Visual Studio.
key_actions: Open issue #18 and review scope, acceptance criteria and tasks
Consider assignment options (GitHub Copilot via GitHub, or from Visual Studio)
ui_elements: Assign to Copilot action (via GitHub or Visual Studio)

sections.title: Trigger Copilot to create a pull request (cloud execution)
sections.summary: After assigning Copilot, refresh the issue to observe that Copilot has started a pull request. The process runs isolated in the cloud and includes environment creation and a fork creation step.
key_actions: Refresh issue list to confirm Copilot has started a PR
Observe Copilot creating the environment and fork for work

sections.title: Review completed PRs and changed files (sample PR #17)
sections.summary: Looks at a previously run PR (#17) as an example: views the changed files, sees new unit tests added for product and store, and checks the session summary showing the steps performed and duration (~18 minutes).
key_actions: View 'Files changed' to inspect new unit test files
Review session log and overall steps (get repository, make a plan, view source code)

sections.title: Monitor current PR run and GitHub Actions logs
sections.summary: Checks the current pull request running: opens details to see that the work is executed via GitHub Actions and examines the action run logs to follow progress.
key_actions: Open GitHub Actions run associated with PR
Inspect action run logs to follow execution steps

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot (agent) to implement missing unit tests
Assigning issues to Copilot from GitHub or Visual Studio
Monitoring cloud-executed pull requests and sessions
Inspecting changed files and unit test additions
Viewing GitHub Actions workflow runs and logs
video: brk447-07-Implement unit tests using GH Issue.mp4
